newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares slip, seen steady.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares slip, seen steady.

text.p: Slovenian shares eased 0.24 percent on Thursday and traders said they expected the market to show little movement until the end of August.
"Prices are generally considered to be low but at the same time most investors, who have been pulling out since March, haven't yet gained enough confidence to return," a trader said.
The market went into a freefall in March after the Securities Market Agency moved to prohibit the nation's largest mutual fund Proficia Dadas from trading, accusing it of illegal trade practices.
Since then the SBI index has lost 33.5 percent, while shares of financial consultancy Dadas, which owns Proficia Dadas, have plunged 86.4 percent.
"I believe the market may lure investors back in the autumn, when new listings of newly privatised companies are expected," another broker said.
The bourse said up to 15 listings of newly privatised companies could be expected by the end of the year.
* The seven-share SBI index fell 2.32 points to 980.60.
* Six shares fell and five rose, while 12 were untraded.
* Turnover rose to 86.8 million tolars from 43 million.
* Financial consultancy Dadas had the highest turnover, easing 1.85 percent to 33,028 tolars on volume of 1,302 shares for total turnover of 43 million tolars.
* Ordinary shares of bank Dolenjska banka were the leading decliners, shedding 2.05 percent to 10,692 tolars on volume of 65 shares for total turnover of 695,000 tolars.

* Food producer Droga was the biggest gainer, adding on 3.11 percent to 15,423 tolars on volume of 1,959 shares for total turnover of 30.2 million tolars. -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
